org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.modella

Class CoverElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • java.util.HashSet<T>
          • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.HashSet<LTL>
            • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl.LTLSet
              • org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.modella.CoverElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<LTLSet>, java.lang.Iterable<LTL>, java.util.Collection<LTL>, java.util.Set<LTL>

    public class CoverElement
extends LTLSet
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A CoverElement is a set of LTL formulae (literals or formulae of the form "() f") that should be satisfied at the same time. An empty element means that no formula is required to be satisfied, which is equivalent to true. If an element contains inconsistent formulae, all formulae will be removed and a false will be inserted. Also note that the formula f of an LTL formula "() f" in this element may have form "(f1 /\ f2 /\ ...) \/ (g1 / \g2 /\ ...) \/ ..." produced by the postponement optimization.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • fulfill

        public boolean fulfill(LTL formula)
        Returns true if this cover element fulfills a specified promising formula. A cover element fulfills a promising formula is (1) all its sub-states satisfy the promised formula of the input formula or (2) all its sub-states does not satisfy the promising formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - a promising formula
        Returns:
        true if this cover element fulfills the promising formula formula
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if formula is not promising
